result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Atty Glynn and Atty Chung

Bail/bond hearing on August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kathleen Chung.  Annie Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due by September 1, 2022; bail continued. Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Atty Chung
6.28.22 Preliminary Hearing;  Patrick Weishan, Court Reporter
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Arraignment on July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Chabris E Link
Current: c/o Dane County Jail,   (Effective: 06-28-2022)
Prior: 720 N Long Ave, Chicago, IL 60644
Br 5

Reporter:  Patrick Weishan
Preliminary hearing for 22CF890 and 22CF891 (co-defendant's) conducted together; Motions made on both cases (separate) for dismissal; Ct denied motions;  Law Enforcement duly sworn & testified; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover - waives argument; Ct binds both case over; bail continued; trial branch to schedule arraignment
Atty Chung
Atty Glynn appointed
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)
Preliminary hearing on June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,000,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Justin B. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with any family member of the victim. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
- Defendant shall be within their residence except only to attend court hearings, meet with legal counsel, or as necessary during an emergency. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 5

01:45 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Erin Nagy.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by relative of victim. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by relative of victim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in custody in IL per Dane County DA.
Record seal for 30 days or when warrant is served on both defendants
